whyUse.description:
TENSIL Abaca Fiber Tiles absorb and emit moisture into ambient air. This results to a pleasant indoor climate which is good for both comfort and health. This also contributes to lower energy costs and reduced environmental impact.

Abaca has high pH value that discourages mould and material does not rot.
TENSIL Abaca Fiber Tiles improve room acoustics in a simple and modern way. The material is a good sound absorber and reduces echo in the room thereby contributing to restful acoustics.
TENSIL Abaca Fiber Tiles provide protection to your wall and are fire resistant and type-approved as protective cladding.

faqs.question: Where is your production site?
faqs.answer: Within the premises of our abaca farm in Caramoran, Catanduanes Island

faqs.question: What is the estimated production lead time?
faqs.answer: Production starts once you confirm your order. Normal production lead time is 2 to 3 weeks

faqs.question: What colors are available?
faqs.answer: Tiles come in primer white or unpainted natural gray

faqs.question: Can I paint it?
faqs.answer: Yes, we recommend spray paint to maintain its acoustic performance

faqs.question: How do I install them?
faqs.answer: Very simple: use a fairly small amount of rugby adhesive on both the fiber tile and the wall surface. For rough finishes, use either Portland cement or tile adhesive.
